snippet.title: Should kissing an opponent be banned?
snippet.content:
Should kissing an opponent be banned? Nat Edwards and Nick Bowen answer the Burning Question
JARRAD McVeigh, the recipient of Will Langford's pair of kisses at the MCG last Friday night, declared the act as 'disrespectful'.
In the first smooch just before half-time, an incensed McVeigh reacted by shoving the Hawk in the face and was penalised.
After McVeigh kicked a crucial goal early in the last quarter to bring the Swans back to within four points, Langford puckered up again.
"I thought it was pretty disrespectful. But that's the way it is," McVeigh said later on radio.
Have your say here.
